STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 20, 2021
Antoinette Prabucki
Clare County DHHS
725 Richard Drive
Harrison, MI 48625
RE: License #: CP180201067
Clare County DHHS
725 Richard Drive
Harrison, MI 48625
Dear Ms. Prabucki:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 01/07/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(d) Current immunizations for each child as required by
section 5111 of 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111. All of the
following apply:
(iii) If documentation of immunization or a copy of the
waiver is unavailable, then immunizations shall begin
within 30 calendar days of placement.
One of the six current foster care youth records reviewed did not include a copy of
the youth’s immunization record or documentation that immunizations had been
initiated. In this example the youth had an identified placement date of 08/27/2020.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of the six current foster child records reviewed contained an updated service
plan that was not completed within the time frame required by this rule. In this
example the report ending period was 06/08/2020 and the report was identified as
completed 06/25/2020.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22). DHHS will maintain an operational
statewide automated child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which
will be the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
Information that could not be located in the MISACWIS information system
included 2 3706 license documents, 1 foster home application document, and 1
Parent/Agency Treatment Plan for one foster care youth. This is a repeat
violation from the renewal evaluation completed 08/14/2019.
4

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
None required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None required, there were no safety/critical alerts identified as a part of the analyst’s
interviews and evaluation.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
OR
There was one incident of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
The agency recommended revocation of the license 04/16/2020.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
08/14/2019. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that evaluation were R
400.12324 (4) (c), R 400.12327 (5)(d), (6)(b), R 400.12421 (b), ISEP 4.22, and DHHS
Policy 722-06B. The only area identified as a repeat noncompliance as a part of this
interim review is ISEP 4.22.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
5

an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
01/07/2021

Mark R. Hunter Date
